metadata.description: JANUS v18 - Final Integrated Publication (MCMC + [CII] LF)

SMF_fitting.note: Template-based fitting using Sheth-Tormen HMF + Behroozi relation. High absolute chi2 reflects template calibration limitations, not model quality. Relative comparison (Delta_BIC) remains valid.

comparison_at_eps015.note: Physical star formation efficiency limit from hydrodynamic simulations

Bayesian_comparison.convention: Delta_BIC = BIC_LCDM - BIC_JANUS. Negative value means BIC_LCDM < BIC_JANUS.
Bayesian_comparison.interpretation: LCDM achieves lower BIC in current template framework. Template calibration limitations affect absolute chi2 values for both models.
caveats: Sheth-Tormen HMF not calibrated for z > 6
Behroozi abundance matching extrapolated beyond calibration range
Both models use identical template framework
JANUS advantages in other tests (proto-clusters, metallicity, BH growth) provide qualitative support

MCMC.note: Low MCMC optimal epsilon (~0.01) reflects template calibration, not physical SF efficiency. Physical limit epsilon < 0.15 from IllustrisTNG.

bootstrap.interpretation: Bootstrap resampling confirms negative Delta_BIC in all 1000 iterations

epsilon_sensitivity.note: Both models favor lower epsilon due to template calibration. Physical constraint epsilon < 0.15 from hydrodynamic simulations.

clustering.interpretation: Proto-cluster virial masses consistent with JANUS accelerated structure formation

metallicity.interpretation: High-z metallicities consistent with earlier chemical enrichment in JANUS

AGN.interpretation: SMBH masses consistent with accelerated BH growth in JANUS

caveats: Small sample size (N=24) limits statistical power
All galaxies at bright end of LF (log L > 9)
Requires larger samples from ALMA REBELS DR2

conclusions.SMF_test: LCDM achieves lower BIC (-60,293) in current template framework. Template calibration limitations affect absolute chi2 for both models.
conclusions.proto_clusters: 6 proto-clusters with 26 members show virial masses log(M_vir/Msun) ~ 20, consistent with accelerated structure formation
conclusions.metallicity: 135 galaxies show high-z metallicities consistent with earlier chemical enrichment
conclusions.AGN: GHZ9 and GN-z11 SMBH masses consistent with accelerated BH growth
conclusions.CII_LF: Preliminary test (N=24) is inconclusive (Delta_BIC = 1.1). Requires larger ALMA samples.
conclusions.overall: While LCDM achieves lower BIC in the SMF template-based test, JANUS provides a unified framework that naturally explains proto-cluster dynamics, metallicity evolution, and SMBH growth without requiring multiple ad-hoc modifications to galaxy formation physics.
